item.title: Gianna add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "It was the year they fell into devastating love. Neither one could do anything except think about the other, dream about the other, and wait for letters with the same impatience they felt when they answered them." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Rivka Galchen
item.description: "We need to develop a better descriptive vocabulary for lying, a taxonomy, a way to distinguish intentional lies from unintentional ones, and a way to distinguish the lies that the liar himself believes in – a way to signal those lies that could be more accurately described as dreams. Lies – they make for a tidy little psychological Doppler effect, tell us more about a liar than an undistorted self-report ever could." -- Rivka Galchen

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Rivka Galchen
item.description: "Physics advances by accepting absurdities. Its history is one of unbelievable ideas proving to be true." -- Rivka Galchen

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Rivka Galchen
item.description: "I’m interested in [meteorology], but I’m more interested in gross misappropriations of the authoritative language of science. It feels rife with clarity, and yet you don’t understand what it means. And I think that’s beautiful." -- Rivka Galchen

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "How often do we tell our own life story? How often do we adjust, embellish, make sly cuts? And the longer life goes on, the fewer are those around to challenge our account, to remind us that our life is not our life, merely the story we have told about our life. Told to others, but&mdash;mainly&mdash;to ourselves." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "It strikes me that this may be one of the differences between youth and age: when we are young, we invent different futures for ourselves; when we are old, we invent different pasts for others." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "What you end up remembering isn't always the same as what you have witnessed." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "History is that certainty produced at the point where the imperfections of memory meet the inadequacies of documentation." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Gianna add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "The truth is, everyone is going to hurt you. You just got to find the ones worth suffering for." -- Bob Marley

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Marlene Dietrich
item.description: "It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter." -- Marlene Dietrich

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Jess C. Scott
item.description: "When someone loves you, the way they say your name is different. You know that your name is safe in their mouth." -- Jess C. Scott

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Henri Nouwen
item.description: "When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives mean the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand. The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing, not curing, not healing and face with us the reality of our powerlessness, that is a friend who cares." -- Henri Nouwen

item.title: Gianna add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art.... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things which give value to survival." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Margaret Lee Runbeck
item.description: "Silence make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying, but the never needing to say that counts." -- Margaret Lee Runbeck

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Charles Lamb
item.description: "Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected." -- Charles Lamb

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Jay McInerney
item.description: "The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families." -- Jay McInerney

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Each friend represents a world in us, a world possibly not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Gianna add a quote by J. K. Rowling
item.description: "There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them." -- J. K. Rowling

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Gillian Anderson
item.description: "When I think of normality I think of mediocrity" -- Gillian Anderson

item.title: Gianna add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "There is no surer foundation for a beautiful friendship than a mutual taste in literature." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years." -- Richard Bach

item.title: Gianna add a quote by O. Henry
item.description: "No friendship is an accident. " -- O. Henry

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "[Marriage] happens as with cages: the birds without despair to get in, and those within despair of getting out." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Gianna add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "I do not believe, from what I have been told about this people, that there is anything barbarous or savage about them, except that we all call barbarous anything that is contrary to our own habits." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Gianna add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "Among other things, you'll find that you're not the first person who was ever confused and frightened and even sickened by human behavior. You're by no means alone on that score, you'll be excited and stimulated to know. Many, many men have been just as troubled morally and spiritually as you are right now. Happily, some of them kept records of their troubles. You'll learn from them—if you want to. Just as someday, if you have something to offer, someone will learn something from you. It's a beautiful reciprocal arrangement. And it isn't education. It's history. It's poetry." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Gianna add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of the mature man is that he wants to live humbly for one." -- J.D. Salinger
